X-Accepted-Oauth-Scopes: repo, repo:status, repo:deployment, public_repo, delete_repo, user, user:email, user:follow, admin:org, write:org, read:org, gist, site_admin, user:assets, user:assets:read
Access-Control-Expose-Headers: ETag, Link, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval

undefined method `new__session_path' for #<Devise::FailureApp:0x00000103610518>

Any advise?"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/comments/148137","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/commit/a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243#commitcomment-148137","id":148137,"user":{"login":"hassox","id":104,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2Fc9e1074f5b3f9fc8ea15d152add07294.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406","url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox","html_url":"https://github.com/hassox","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"position":16,"line":20,"path":"lib/rails_admin.rb","commit_id":"a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243","created_at":"2010-09-16T05:00:09Z","updated_at":"2010-09-16T05:00:09Z","body":"Which version of devise are you using?

Is this an existing app?"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/comments/148141","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/commit/a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243#commitcomment-148141","id":148141,"user":{"login":"hassox","id":104,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2Fc9e1074f5b3f9fc8ea15d152add07294.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406","url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox","html_url":"https://github.com/hassox","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"position":16,"line":20,"path":"lib/rails_admin.rb","commit_id":"a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243","created_at":"2010-09-16T05:19:03Z","updated_at":"2010-09-16T05:19:03Z","body":"Is it possible you're getting a blank string for the scope?  

Can you overwrite the method in Devise::FailureApp#scope to output an inspection of the value so that we can be sure of what it is.  Also, what does Devise.default_scope give you?
"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/comments/148859","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/commit/a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243#commitcomment-148859","id":148859,"user":{"login":"kaapa","id":215071,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/40a0afa49eb7b12db4dcda70b2e1520d?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2F8123ff067b6671a4eba2b1fc019250cc.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"40a0afa49eb7b12db4dcda70b2e1520d","url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa","html_url":"https://github.com/kaapa","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"position":16,"line":20,"path":"lib/rails_admin.rb","commit_id":"a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243","created_at":"2010-09-16T21:20:53Z","updated_at":"2010-09-16T21:20:53Z","body":"Hello, thank you for the help!

Application is dummy_app contained within rails_admin (included within rails_admin spec in the sources)
Devise version is 1.1.2
Warden version is 0.10.7
Ruby version is 1.9.2

Overwriting Devise::FailureApp#scope: 

inspecting @scope.class.name after the assignment
=> NilClass

Inspecting warden_options[:scope]
=> NilClass

inspecting Devise.default_scope
=> "user"

Naturally if overwriting the Devise::FailureApp#scope to return "user" everything works nicely.

Dummy_app has devise_for :users in routes file so "user" would be the expected return value for Devise::FailureApp#scope.

Hope you can give me some directions, I can't seem to figure it out by myself!

P."},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/comments/148957","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/commit/a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243#commitcomment-148957","id":148957,"user":{"login":"hassox","id":104,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2Fc9e1074f5b3f9fc8ea15d152add07294.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406","url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox","html_url":"https://github.com/hassox","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"position":16,"line":20,"path":"lib/rails_admin.rb","commit_id":"a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243","created_at":"2010-09-16T23:09:50Z","updated_at":"2010-09-16T23:52:24Z","body":"Can you try changing Devise::FailureApp#scope to
<pre>
def scope
  @scope ||= warden_options[:scope] || Devise.default_scope
  @scope
end
</pre>

If you need to, please feel free to hit me up on IM.  has.sox at gmail"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/comments/149001","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/commit/a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243#commitcomment-149001","id":149001,"user":{"login":"kaapa","id":215071,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/40a0afa49eb7b12db4dcda70b2e1520d?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2F8123ff067b6671a4eba2b1fc019250cc.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"40a0afa49eb7b12db4dcda70b2e1520d","url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa","html_url":"https://github.com/kaapa","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/kaapa/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"position":16,"line":20,"path":"lib/rails_admin.rb","commit_id":"a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243","created_at":"2010-09-16T23:43:47Z","updated_at":"2010-09-16T23:43:47Z","body":"Hey that fixed it - cheers!

However, for the whole authentication system, in Rails 3.1 I would like rails admin to be agnostic sine we will be able to do the following in the router:

    authenticate :user do
      mount Rails::Admin, :at => "/admin"
    end

authenticate simply uses the router constraints API passing a proc that calls warden authenticate."},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sferik/rails_admin/comments/149188","html_url":"https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin/commit/a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243#commitcomment-149188","id":149188,"user":{"login":"hassox","id":104,"avatar_url":"https://gravatar.com/avatar/9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406?d=https%3A%2F%2Fidenticons.github.com%2Fc9e1074f5b3f9fc8ea15d152add07294.png&r=x","gravatar_id":"9d1f5d2d9de70bd9a934f557dc95a406","url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox","html_url":"https://github.com/hassox","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/hassox/received_events","type":"User","site_admin":false},"position":16,"line":20,"path":"lib/rails_admin.rb","commit_id":"a44bb3c061167b441d45fd3b1478fc1d4425a243","created_at":"2010-09-17T06:29:26Z","updated_at":"2010-09-17T06:29:26Z","body":"I don't see the two as collliding.
